We are looking at a $2 million impact because of COVID-19.  Why doesn't our municipality and our taxpayers deserve relief? For those keeping track, Bridgewater is the largest municipality in Rep. source: Rik Mehta for Senate,Gloucester County GOP
text: I'm proud to earn the endorsement of Gloucester County Republicans and thank Chairwoman Jacci Vigilante for her strong leadership. Keep your eyes on Gloucester County, folks, it is one of the emerging GOP counties in our state!  It's an honor to share the line under President Trump and with Congressman Van Drew. Together, we will make #jerseyproud in Washington!South Jersey is Trump Country Fellow Republicans: If you haven’t noticed – SOUTH JERSEY IS TRUMP COUNTRY! It truly is an exciting time to be a Republican in South Jersey. Just this past Friday evening, the Gloucester County GOP held our Third Annual Lincoln Reagan Dinner. Our featured speaker was the Honorable Kellyanne Conway, Special Counselor to President Donald Trump. The White House, under any administration, doesn’t send high level presidential advisors to events in places that don’t matter. If Ms. Conway’s presence at our Lincoln Reagan Dinner doesn’t convince you that South Jersey is Trump Country consider this:  October 2019: Eric and Lara Trump appear at a Camden County GOP fundraiser. December 2019: Congressman Jeff Van Drew switches parties and is now our incumbent Republican Congressman. January 2020: President Donald Trump holds a rally in Wildwood. Last week: John Pence, Senior Advisor to President Trump’s re-election campaign visits Egg Harbor Township to take part in Trump Victory Leadership Initiative Training. This past Friday: Kellyanne Conway was the keynote speaker at the Gloucester County GOP fundraiser. A Congressman flipped, a Presidential rally, a visit by the President’s son and daughter-in-law, a visit by the Vice President’s nephew and a visit by the Special Counselor to the President all within four months shows how important South Jersey is to Donald Trump. As an organization, it is our job to keep the momentum going, and we will!!! The Gloucester County GOP has announced our Freeholder Candidates. Greenwich Township Mayor George Shivery has decided not to run for a seventh consecutive term as Mayor and instead is running for Freeholder, George’s record speaks for itself. Woodbury Heights business owner Chris Konawel brings his years of business experience to the team, make no mistake, he’s a fighter, in the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation to be exact. Rounding out the team is Franklin Township School Board member since 2015 Nick DeSilvio. Since joining the Board they have stayed below the 2% tax cap and just last year Nick found taxpayers a savings of $200,000. We have a solid team running for Freeholder.  The top of the ticket is exciting – President Donald Trump – you know his record, a booming economy, a stronger military and he’s building the wall, making our nation safer. In the US Senate race, after a thorough screening process, the Screening Committee recommended to the Executive Board Rik Mehta gets the Party line. The Executive Board agrees, Rik Mehta is the Gloucester County GOP’s endorsed candidate for US Senate. Also, earning the party’s endorsement for the Second Congressional District (CD2) is incumbent Congressman Jeff Van Drew. Gloucester County GOP is proud to join President Trump in endorsing Congressman Van Drew. In the First Congressional District (CD1) Claire Gustafson has earned the party’s endorsement. For those who don’t know Claire has repeatedly stepped up for the Camden County GOP, is a former member of the School Board in Collingswood, is the Collingswood Republican chair and most recently resurrected Camden County’s Republican women organization. Both, Congressman Van Drew and Claire Gustafson care about our county and respect our process, so much so that while no other candidates for Congress in either district asked to be screened they both appeared before the Screening Committee because they wanted to earn our endorsement and not simply be given the line. As your County GOP Chairwoman, I am excited that South Jersey is Trump Country. I’m proud of the work our Screening Committee did vetting candidates for federal office. And, there is no doubt we have assembled a fantastic team of Freeholder candidates. I look forward too much electoral success in 2020! Jacci Vigilante Chairwoman- Gloucester County GOP

text: The energy was unreal last night. Thank you Union County. I will make you #JerseyProud!Congratulations to Rik Mehta for Senate on his victory last night! #jerseyproud #USSenate

As a first-generation American who worked hard and earned everything I’ve got, I am confident that my candidacy is best positioned to make that vision a reality and take our conservative message into every community in New Jersey.
Proud to win the Union County GOP endorsement last night and be on ballot under President Donald J. Trump! #jerseyproud  https://newjerseyglobe.com/congress/mehta-wins-union-gop-line/

I am honored and humbled to win the state’s first GOP County Convention tonight in Union County. It’s a sign of our growing momentum and proof that our conservative, Jersey Proud message is resonating!
The energy is palpable! Time to make New Jersey a place to live, not leave. Let's be #jerseyproud together!

The out pour of support for the president's visit to New Jersey tomorrow is an omen of great things to come in our little state. Cory Booker and the rest of NJ Do Nothing Democrats should be shaking in their boots. Tomorrow over 100,000 #JerseyProud patriots will be showing their support for a better New Jersey and a Stronger America. See you there!

Thank you to Camden County Republican Committee and the Gloucester County GOP for the invitation to speak about my U.S. Senate platform that will make New Jersey a place to live, not leave. An honor to be part of this momentous occasion and fire up the rally! #jerseyproud

Always an inspiration to be at the Cumberland County GOP breakfast and share my U.S. Senate platform on how NJ Republicans are going to end the healthcare debate, lower prescription drug prices and make NJ a place to live, not leave. #jerseyproud.  @ Eastlyn Golf Course & The Greenview Inn

Okay, this was a blast! A fun and engaging conversation on The Advocates with a man who is #jerseyproud, @dancirucci. Talking family, #mythreesons, my grandparents' building a life in Cherry Hill and my U.S. Senate run to make New Jersey a place to live, not leave. @ RVN TV

Okay, this was a blast! A fun and engaging conversation on The Advocates with a man who is #jerseyproud, @dancirucci. Talking family, #mythreesons, my grandparents' building a life in Cherry Hill and my U.S. Senate run to make New Jersey a place to live, not leave.  @ RVN TV
Great evening celebrating Assemblywoman Jean Stanfield and Assemblyman Ryan Peters who are making New Jersey a place to live, not leave. Let's be #jerseyproud together!

Had such an amazing time in Atlantic County this morning supporting Jim Curcio for surrogate. Great to be with good friends again. It is truly inspiring to see all the energy and excitement our Republican Party is giving off. We are so ready to make Jersey a place to live, not leave!

Remebering 3 years ago today being invited to, and attending the President @realdonaldtrump and VP @mikepence inauguration and Ball. Reema and I hanging out with @governorabbott, like NBD. And, of course, my little gentlemen always behaving #jerseyproud #mythreesons #maga @ Washington D.C.

Where my three little gentlemen will continue to live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character. And, the bravery of our leaders past have blessed us to embody that Dream.

Proud to support the newly minted Barrington Republican Club tonight. Now let's get some Republican candidates for council, Barrington, and make New Jersey a place to live, not leave. Let's be  together!

Did you catch this week's Wall Street Journal? They confirmed my main campaign issue: Physicians are burning out at alarming rates due to administrative tasks and work hours. Over-regulation is wasting billions of dollars that could be passed back to patients and lower healthcare costs. As your next U.S. Senator, I will FIX this regulatory mess, improve the practice of medicine and lower costs. Join my fight and donate to fix healthcare: https://secure.winred.com/rik-mehta-for-senate/action-60545 https://www.wsj.com/articles/physician-burnout-widespread-especially-among-those-midcareer-report-says-11579086008 Don't let the fake impeachment hearings be a sleight of hand - there are real issues affecting real people that we need to keep focused on. Let's make New Jersey a place to live, not leave. Let's be #jerseryproud together!

LIKE & SHARE IF YOU STAND AGAINST THE CATASTROPHIC MURPHY ADMINISTRATION I stand with the state Republican Party who saw through Governor Murphy’s disingenuous rhetoric at the State of the State this afternoon. Despite beginning on the right track by condemning antisemitism and domestic terrorism, Murphy, like always has proven that his administration keeps pushing failed policies. Murphy asserts that he is trying to build a state that works for every New Jersey family but he has spent the entirety of his term working to push an agenda that does the exact opposite. He preached that he was an advocate of Jersey Pride but his administration is the leading cause of 44% of New Jersey residents planning to leave our state. He claims that he made New Jersey a better place to call home except his policies don’t allow anyone to buy a home. He has been an abject failure at making Jersey Proud. #PolicyOverPolitics #JerseyProud https://rikfornj.com/

Now that Spartacus is coming back to Jersey, it is time New Jerseyeans show him that we are sick of the same old, failed politics. This is not only a referendum of the country but the thoughts of our neighbors, friends, and family. Want to be #JerseyProud? Sign up now to volunteer and donate here https://secure.winred.com/rik-mehta-for-senate/action-60545. Let's be #JerseyProud together! https://www.insidernj.com/mehta-jeers-booker-senator-returns-nj/
Catch me tonight on the Joe Concha Show @iHeartRadio 710am WOR where I challenge Cory Booker to debate me! We must make Jersey a place to live, not leave.

As I predicted, Cory Booker has dropped out of the Presidential race. Now he'll have to face me. New Jerseyeans need a leader who will serve them, not build their career off the backs of our proud communities. It's time to be #jerseyproud. I’d like to give a thanks to some of my interns for coming out to help and phone bank. I always love hearing their stories and why they are #jerseyproud .If you’d like to get involved, donate, volunteer or do an internship, please head to www.rikfornj.com and click on the volunteer section! @ Chester Township, New Jersey

My thoughts on the recent events in Iran. “Last night, Iran launched over a dozen missiles into our military bases all across Iraq. Days prior, they attacked our American Embassy. This clear act of aggression by Iran can not be tolerated. As a nation, we must strive for peace. For warmongering countries like Iran, we must stand with our military, and use all available resources to protect our national interests, our allies, and our Americans abroad. No one wants war, but Americans will not compromise freedom. I am also shocked by the actions of Cory Booker, the Senator is crying “abuse of power” all over the media because of the president's use of one drone strike. Where was Cory Booker during the 571 drone strikes that President Obama ordered? The hypocrisy coming from Senator Booker's failing presidential campaign is shameful.” -Rik

I’m looking forward to working hard with Bergen County to make Jersey a place to live, not leave. Let’s be #jerseyproud  @ Bergen County Republican Organization

text: If you’re #JerseyProud, make sure to get out and vote Republican today! Phil Murphy and the highfalutin, money-bagging Dems have failed us for far too long. Let’s win today, and show Cory Booker what’s in store for him next year! https://bit.ly/36AisXC20 Reasons New Jersey Is Weaker And Poorer Under Phil Murphy 20 Reasons To Vote Republican In The 2019 Murphy Mid-Terms 1 Day Until Election Day Trenton, NJ – The NJGOP is counting down the last 20 days before Election Day in the  2019 Murphy Mid-Terms with 20 reasons New Jersey is weaker and poorer under Governor Phil Murphy and 20 reasons to vote Republican on November 5th. Reason #1: Rain Tax Comment from NJGOP Chairman Doug Steinhardt: “A rainy day fund used to be what responsible government collected for emergencies. Not anymore. Not in New Jersey. And not under Governor Murphy. Today, it’s just another Democratic property tax and Trenton money grab. Instead of feeding your families, Phil Murphy’s rain tax scheme drains money from your pockets and pours it into Trenton’s coffers, to feed Murphy’s liberal agenda. None of that should come as a surprise, since the Governor let slip that, “If tax rate is your issue … we’re probably not your state.”

Congratulations Dr. Stephen Hahn! I fully support this decision, and I am excited about the future of FDA. https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/policy/healthcare/trump-nominates-texas-oncologist-stephen-hahn-to-lead-fda

One of New Jersey's greatest leaders and a personal political hero of mine, former Governor Thomas Kean and I discussed ways to make Jersey a place to live, not leave.  Governor Kean served as Governor of New Jersey from 1982-1990 and then as Chairman of the National Commission on Terrorist Attacks Upon the United States -- tasked with protecting America from future terrorist attacks.   Leadership like his is exactly what I am bringing back in 2020.

I went on Fox News to ask a simple question.  Where is Cory Booker?  He's not in Washington doing the job that he was elected to do. He's certainly not in New Jersey, helping the people who put him in office.  He might be in Iowa - or maybe New Hampshire - holding events with voters he doesn't represent while running in a race that he'll never win. I don't know where he is, but I do know he isn't doing his job.  Watch my interview below.   https://bit.ly/2N5OaD4

Cory Booker thinks his job in the Senate is to fight the President at any expense.  But, what about when it's at the expense of working class New Jerseyeans?   A Senator's job is to fight for the communities they were elected to represent - not showpony around to others.  We need a change in 2020 -- if you think it’s time to FIRE Cory Booker, join my 2020 fight.  Let's be  together.

Let’s win today, and show Cory Booker what’s in store for him next year! https://bit.ly/36AisXC20 Reasons New Jersey Is Weaker And Poorer Under Phil Murphy 20 Reasons To Vote Republican In The 2019 Murphy Mid-Terms 1 Day Until Election Day Trenton, NJ – The NJGOP is counting down the last 20 days before Election Day in the  2019 Murphy Mid-Terms with 20 reasons New Jersey is weaker and poorer under Governor Phil Murphy and 20 reasons to vote Republican on November 5th. Reason #1: Rain Tax Comment from NJGOP Chairman Doug Steinhardt: “A rainy day fund used to be what responsible government collected for emergencies. Not anymore. Not in New Jersey. And not under Governor Murphy. Today, it’s just another Democratic property tax and Trenton money grab. Instead of feeding your families, Phil Murphy’s rain tax scheme drains money from your pockets and pours it into Trenton’s coffers, to feed Murphy’s liberal agenda. None of that should come as a surprise, since the Governor let slip that, “If tax rate is your issue … we’re probably not your state.”

Congratulations Dr. Stephen Hahn! I fully support this decision, and I am excited about the future of FDA. https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/policy/healthcare/trump-nominates-texas-oncologist-stephen-hahn-to-lead-fda

One of New Jersey's greatest leaders and a personal political hero of mine, former Governor Thomas Kean and I discussed ways to make Jersey a place to live, not leave.  Governor Kean served as Governor of New Jersey from 1982-1990 and then as Chairman of the National Commission on Terrorist Attacks Upon the United States -- tasked with protecting America from future terrorist attacks.   Leadership like his is exactly what I am bringing back in 2020.
Democrats REFUSE to accept the election results of 2016. Today, 232 Democrats voted to begin the impeachment process. This partisan charade must stop.  https://fxn.ws/2WuM9oh

I went on Fox News to ask a simple question.  Where is Cory Booker?  He's not in Washington doing the job that he was elected to do. He's certainly not in New Jersey, helping the people who put him in office.  He might be in Iowa - or maybe New Hampshire - holding events with voters he doesn't represent while running in a race that he'll never win. I don't know where he is, but I do know he isn't doing his job.  Watch my interview below.   https://bit.ly/2N5OaD4

Cory Booker thinks his job in the Senate is to fight the President at any expense.  But, what about when it's at the expense of working class New Jerseyeans?   A Senator's job is to fight for the communities they were elected to represent - not showpony around to others.  We need a change in 2020 -- if you think it’s time to FIRE Cory Booker, join my 2020 fight.  Let's be  together.

I’m running for Senate to send Spartacus Cory Booker packing in 2020. When Cory is done showboating for the media, he’ll run back to New Jersey to pretend he cares about our state. Make no mistake, he only cares about himself.  That’s why I’m running to FIRE Senator Cory Booker in 2020.  Join my fight to Make New Jersey Proud and help me win in 2020:
